many unanswered questions about too many important people, companies and institutions...[ This] suggests that David Cameron 's lack of judgment over Andy Coulson is even more striking." uncomfortable questions remain for the prime minister. This affair casts serious doubt on the prime minister's judgment. He saw fit to appoint Mr Andy Coulson as the Conservative party's director of communications when the former editor was tarred by association with the phone-hacking scandal. Why would he want such a compromised spokesman? Was he naive enough to believe Mr Andy Coulson 's assurances? Or did he not care about what had taken place? Neither scenario is very comforting. felt he's been punished for the same offence twice but I quite understand his decision and wish him well for the future."( Asked if it raised questions about David Cameron 's judgement) I don't think so at all because Andy Coulson resigned from News of the World when he found out what was happening. akin to Johnny Carson 's seems unreachable, and even the heights he, Jay Leno and David Letterman have experienced seem elusive for any host to achieve going forward. O'Brien agrees late night's future seems murky. I don't think anybody knows, O'Brien tells PopcornBiz. "We don't know if late night shows are going to be a pill that you take in three years or a saline drop that goes in your eye. None of us knows.

CEO title at Google to cofounder Larry Page NEW YORK( CNNMoney)-- Google CEO Eric Schmidt will step down from his role as Google's CEO in April and be replaced by co-founder Larry Page. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Eric Schmidt said in a prepared statement. he sees no reason why the military shouldn't be considered for spending cuts as lawmakers grapple with the ballooning deficit. Mr. Colin Powell pointed out that defense spending had at one time been cut 25%. I don't think the defense budget should be made sacrosanct, he said. The Obama administration has proposed cutting$ 78 billion from the military budget in the next five years.
